(hopefully) I can assure you with time it does get easier. Wishing you all the best. Clare

Posts.Content: Hi, I am new to this site. Hope I have posted this correctly. I now have a date for my DIEP reconstruction- 29th January 2016 at at Salisbury Hospital. I had a mastectomy over 13 years ago when I was 32 and I have worked really hard to lose weight(9 stone) to be considered for surgery. I am naturally anxious and excited about having this surgery and also looking forward to not having to wear my prosthesis. I was wondering from other ladies experiences approximately how long after surgery I would be able to go abroad(fly) as I am thinking about holidays next year. I would appreciate any help or advice.  Kind Regards Clare
Posts.Title: Diep Reconstruction

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, I had my DIEP 6 weeks ago now and I have to say I am feeling really quite well. I am 99% healed. My pain has been fine on the whole. I could get about almost straight away. Yes I did feel that I had been knocked down by a bus at the start and the time in recovery in hospital was probably the worst experience for me. I was in a week and everyone including the surgeon said how well I had done, I was so nervous before hand. I have met the surgeon again who has discussed and agreed my next surgery. It is so strange now not to have my prosthesis and great to go shopping and feel whole again and confident in my clothes.  My result is not 100% perfect but with the second surgery it will improve and I am still very very happy. Thanks for all the support!!!! Clare
